instructions: Image titled Use AirPods Step 1 1 Unlock your iPhone. Press the Home button using Touch ID or enter your passcode on the lock screen. Image titled Use AirPods Step 2 2 Press the Home button. Doing so returns you to the home screen, if you weren't already there. Image titled Use AirPods Step 3 3 Hold the AirPods case next to your iPhone. The AirPods must be in the case and the lid closed. Image titled Use AirPods Step 4 4 Open the lid on the AirPods case. A setup assistant will launch on your iPhone. Image titled Use AirPods Step 5 5 Tap . The pairing process will begin. Image titled Use AirPods Step 6 6 Tap . Your iPhone is now paired with your AirPods. If you're signed into iCloud, the AirPods will automatically be paired with any other devices that are running iOS 10.2 or higher or OS Sierra (Mac), and signed into iCloud with the same Apple ID. Advertisement

Image titled Use AirPods Step 7 1 Hold the AirPods case next to your iPhone. The AirPods must be in the case and the lid closed. Image titled Use AirPods Step 8 2 Open the lid on the AirPods case. Image titled Use AirPods Step 9 3 Press and hold the "Setup" button. It's a small, round button on the back of the AirPods case. Hold the button until the status light flashes white. Image titled Use AirPods Step 10 4 Open your iPhone's Settings. It's a gray app that contains gears ( ) and is typically located on your home screen. Image titled Use AirPods Step 11 5 Tap . It's near the top of the menu. Image titled Use AirPods Step 12 6 Slide "Bluetooth" to the "On" position. It will turn green. Image titled Use AirPods Step 13 7 Tap . It will appear in the "OTHER DEVICES" section. Once the AirPods are paired, they will appear in the "MY DEVICES" section of the menu. Advertisement

Image titled Spot Fake Airpods Step 6 1 Open your AirPods case and press the pairing button on your device. If you get a notification to connect using SwiftPair, then accept it. This is the same way to get a stylus, keyboard, or mouse paired with your device. Image titled Connect Bluetooth Headphones to a PC Step 5 2 Open Bluetooth settings in Settings > Devices > Bluetooth and other devices. Image titled Connect Bluetooth Headphones to a PC Step 6 3 Tap "Add a Device". Image titled Connect Bluetooth Headphones to a PC Step 7 4 Choose "Bluetooth". Image titled Clean AirPods Step 7 5 Choose the AirPods. Image titled Check for Updates on Your Android Phone Step 6 6 Let Windows Update finish the pairing process. Image titled Spot Fake Airpods Step 13 7 Start listening to your computer. You are done. Advertisement

Image titled Use AirPods Step 23 1 Remove AirPods from their case. When removed, they are powered on and ready to be used: There is no on/off switch. Image titled Use AirPods Step 24 2 Put AirPods in your ears. Once in place, they are automatically connected to the audio output from the paired device you're using; you needn't do anything more to hear passive audio like alert sounds and ringtones over your AirPods. Start a song, podcast, video, or other audio playback on your paired device to listen with your AirPods. AirPods connect to iPhone and Apple Watch simultaneously. This means that you will hear audio from both your iPhone and Apple Watch on your AirPods without having to switch or pair them again. Image titled Use AirPods Step 25 3 Double tap an AirPod. Doing so activates Siri, answers an incoming phone call, disconnects a call, or switches to another call. AirPods are designed to be controlled with Siri. Commands like "Play my playlist," "Skip to the next song," and "Turn up the volume" -- as well as others -- can be performed with AirPods' Siri functionality. To change the double-tap function to play or pause music, open Settings when AirPods are nearby, tap Bluetooth , tap your AirPods, then tap Play/Pause in the "DOUBLE-TAP ON AIRPODS" section. Image titled Use AirPods Step 26 4 Remove one AirPod from your ear. This pauses audio playback on the paired device. Image titled Use AirPods Step 27 5 Remove both AirPods from your ears. This stops audio playback on the paired device. Advertisement
